documents.document: Voters understandably begin to think, "they're all the same, let's try something different," and we end up with Brexit, Trump, fascism...
Stephen Kinnock may well feel sympathy for an unemployed constituent whose benefits have been sanctioned but has no idea how it feels.
begin to see the world from the same perspective as billionaires. A professional political class, often hereditary, grows up.
Mr Murdoch explained why for the long term good of the media we need to take this approach. Gradual seduction, centre left politicians
There doesn't have to be overt corruption, Â£1m to sign this contract, they start to see the world from the same perspective.
When the Blairs and Clintons left office they slipped into the lifestyles of the super-rich: private planes to private island holidays.
Stricken by Alzheimer's Wilson had to be taken to House of Lords, unable to understand because his only income was expenses.
Harold Wilson used to holiday in Scilly Isles., left office with about Â£1,000 savings in Post Office account, needed Lords expenses to live.
Biggest change in UK politics in my lifetime is takeover by big money. PM for much of my childhood was Harold Wilson.
Conservatives and Republicans do anything their financial backers want. The alternatives, Blair & Clinton don't do anything they object to.
The problem with 'democracy' US/UK style https://t.co/NudTpSTped Corporations and the super-rich have bought both sides.
The alt-right (as it's politically correct to call Nazis nowadays) are very keen on freedom of speech. Until they get the power to censor.
Just a reference, but if a word is being used in a specialised, rather than a general sense it's way too early. any opinions on it?
Read the much-praised Essex Serpent this week. Very enjoyable, good sense of period but... Did anyone else spot a whopping anachronism?
which also affects mental capacity, some form of dementia, on the other hand, a real worry.
a plethora of the world's most expert psychiatrists attested Trump does not have NPD.. PD just a label.. Progressive physical condition
of Borderline Personality Disorder and I'd have felt much happier with her running a country (BPD and all) than the Trump I see even if

Dreary, dreary days. Momentum has descended into interminable procedural wrangling, has it? Never saw that coming.
"... based around the following points. ONE, a 35 hour working week with no loss of pay." Buzz! Militant!
You're not a true leftie until you can spot the flavour of Trot *before* they finish their trademark cliche. "A clear socialist programme"
from @DAaronovitch (or similar) on how failure to spot the differences between the CPGB & CPGB (M-L) exposes me as a bourgeois dilettante.
Riffing on the conversational tics of far left grouplets has given me an alarming flashback to my student days. Now expecting a lecture
And as for the dazzling wit of the CPGB (Marxist-Leninist) well, you'll just have to attend a local Momentum meeting for yourself.
So unlike the IMG: every one a mixture of Oscar Wilde and Stephen Fry: epigrams aplenty, cliches zero.
You can have a more thoughtful, witty individual, in depth conversation with a Jehovah's Witness than an SWPer.
Apart from moral qualms SWP front events should be avoided because they contain SWP members: dreary,dogma-spouting automatons.

not in thrall to corporate lobbyists, promoting UBI? Too much to ask? Disgusted by housing policy of many London Labour councils.
I just want a Labour party committed to fighting inequality, defending NHS, rebuilding social housing, opposing racism...
I initially backed Corbyn because I wanted principle over spin. Milne can't spin & Brexit shows Corbyn lacks principles too.
Abstained 2nd time because I was furious with PLP for putting internal Labour issues 1st when UK was in crisis, PM had resigned

The second, much superior, bus is fairly whizzing along. Not, sadly, to my preferred destination, but we can't have everything.
The bus driver evidently shared my frustration at the rate of progress. I am now on another bus.
The bus is moving considerably less rapidly than I - no Mo Farah - could walk.
Despite not being @Gary_Bainbridge I am on a bus.

Though, admittedly,, there are one or two slight risks (Hepatitis, addiction, fatal OD) associated with heroin so maybe no drugs at all?
measure to reduce mental harm. Always take cocaine in conjunction with heroin. Taking both together reduces the mental damage of coke.
If you absolutely must take cocaine and would prefer not to turn into a gibbering, paranoid wreck there is a key, somewhat counter-intuitive
I do not endorse the use of recreational drugs but if someone insists on taking them I can offer one harm reduction tip
I can see, regrettably, how the state of the world might make someone think that hard drugs might ease the distress.

Until recently being insufficiently hostile to Russia was akin to admitting a sexual interest in sheep as a vote winner in US politics.
As a child of the 60s I can believe the USA would elect a racist president, but I'd never have thought one beholden to Russia could win.
